definition: to massacre/to slaughter
to destroy/to spoil/to ruin/to injure/cruel/oppressive/savage/brutal/incomplete/disabled/to remain/to survive/remnant/surplus
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely
to massacre one another (idiom); internecine strife
killer/butcher/slaughterer

sentences.english: Some groups even fought one another.
sentences.chinese: 一些組織甚至自相殘殺。

sentences.english: So they are still capable of drawing back from a fratricidal war.
sentences.chinese: 所以他們仍有能力免於經歷這場自相殘殺。

sentences.english: Arab League wolf et al. , for revenges for Brother Jiang, has massacred in a big way.
sentences.chinese: 阿狼等人爲了替江氏兄弟報仇，殘殺了大大。

sentences.english: No one expects us to choose sides in internecine mommy battles.
sentences.chinese: 沒人期待自相殘殺的媽媽們戰鬥中選擇離場。

sentences.english: The butcher follows the dog into the bus.
sentences.chinese: 殘殺者按照牽轉具進總線之內。

sentences.english: We must stop to cannibalize each other.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須停止互相殘殺。

sentences.english: The Frankish duke wept bitterly to see his soldiers massacred.
sentences.chinese: 那法蘭克大公悲痛地哭着看着自已的士兵被殘殺。

sentences.english: They do, and it walks across the road, with the butcher following him all the way.
sentences.chinese: 他們做，而且它走過路，藉由後繼他所有的路殘殺者。

sentences.english: Wherefore you are witnesses against yourselves, that you are the sons of them that killed the prophets.
sentences.chinese: 這樣你們自己作證，你們是那些殘殺先知者的子孫了。

sentences.english: Tyrannosaurus Rex may have been a cannibal, new evidence suggests.
sentences.chinese: 有新證據證明霸王龍可能會自相殘殺。

sentences.english: This is the tidbit which tempts his insectivorous fate.
sentences.chinese: 就是這一點東西引誘它殘殺昆蟲。

sentences.english: I don't think people vary in their feelings about baby killing.
sentences.chinese: 對於殘殺嬰兒的行爲，人們的感覺是一樣的。

sentences.english: The pirates roamed with impunity, often ransacking and even decimating coastal settlements.
sentences.chinese: 這些盜賊肆無忌憚，經常掠奪甚至殘殺沿海的居民。
他們殘殺了所有的俘虜。

sentences.english: A grisly period of internecine war and cannibalism seems to have followed.
sentences.chinese: 一段可怕的內戰時期和自相殘殺的時期似乎接踵而至。

sentences.english: And thus for wider carnage taught to pant.
sentences.chinese: 如此教唆殘殺，直到氣喘咻咻。

definition: to loot/looting
to execute (a condemned criminal)
to bully/to push around
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to loot/to pillage/to sack
hostile/malevolence/antagonism/to view as enemy/to stand against
to collapse and fall apart (idiom); to break up/falling to pieces
to chase to kill
unfettered and beyond the law (idiom); evading retribution/getting away with it (e.g. crimes)/still at large
to conspire
ironclad evidence/conclusive proof
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
to become enemies/to become hostile towards
to plunder/to pillage/to forcibly take
not to shrink from any crime (idiom); to commit any imaginable misdeed
